intro: Forsteronia leptocarpa var. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed forsteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, glabrous stems and lanceolate leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and early summer. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
